title: For Sale:  FS/FT: Exceedingly Rare WW1 Colt 1911. 99% Original and Correct. 1918 Manufacture. US Property
postcontent: For sale or trade I have a beautiful example of a WW1 Colt "Black Army" 1911 that is in near mint almost unissued condition. I have had this firearm examined by experts at the premiere auction house in the US and they all agree this is a 100% original and correct Black Army with the consensus being it is one of the finest they have ever seen. I have recent Email corospondence with this auction house putting the Pre-Auction estimate of this Firearm at $6500-$9500 and the head of the firearms division with whom I have been speaking believes it would top $10,000. Copies of Emails will be included I desired. If I do not receive any interest in either trades or a sale I will be cosigning this gun with said auction company for their March auction. As you can see my asking price is much lower than the low estimate given by the auction company. I would mainly like to trade or do a cash/trade for this firearm for other Pre WW1 US 1911s that are all correct, original, and in good condition. I would trade this 1911 straight up for a first year manufacture 1911 preferably under serial number 6500 but would consider any 1912 manufacture dates. I would also consider trading straight for a Navy marked 1911 or possibly multiple 1911s that are pre 1918 serial numbers. When the gun was inspected by the auction company here are some high points I would like to share. There is slight speckling around the patent date on the slide and that is what is called casting imperfections and is not pitting. Casting imperfections were inherent in many 1918 black armys as production was sped up to meet the US army's contracts. Their are also some stamping imperfections which can be seen from stamps beginning to wear out mainly visible on the Y in property and the top of the inspectors mark. I was told they have seen dozens of other examples very close to this serial number that exhibit all the same stamping imperfections so this as stated were just the stamps coming to the end of their usefulness. When the firearm was examined under bright lighting there is an overall even brown aging appearance that can be seen over the entire gun which is what you want to see in a gun that is almost 100 years old. I tried to capture this in the picture but it was near impossible. Overall there are only a handful of WW1 1911s in existence that are still in this high of condition and pictures do not do this gun justice as the stampings are much deeper in person so I urge anyone interested If able to come view this firearm in person. I'm sure if you are familiar with these pistols you know how rare black army gun are in this condition as the finish wasn't known to hold up very well. The only wear on the entire firearm is extremely minute holster wear at the front of the muzzle and a very small amount near the lanyard loop by the mainspring housing. The barrel has some pitting which I assume was from firing the gun with the coorosive ammo of the time and not cleaning it. I have many more pictures I can email or text upon request. E-mail, call, or text REDACTED

title: For Sale:  Antique US Remington Rolling Block Pistol
postcontent: Antique US Remington Rolling Block Pistol, RARE. Stock # C-CO RT. No Serial # . One of over a thousand Modern and Collectible firearms, including Antique, Military, Sporting, Custom and Tactical guns, as well as Edged Weapons and Militaria, This is a very rare US Contract (Probably the Model 1865, although we’re not sure) Remington Rolling Block Pistol. Chambered for .50 Rimfire, the pistol has a 7” round barrel, a blue finish on the barrel, hammer and block, a casehardened receiver and wooden stocks. The left side of the receiver is marked “ REMINGTONS ILION NY USA” w/the patent dates. The left side of the receiver also has the initials “P” and “S”, these are Inspector marks. There is also a nice cartouche on the left grip. Most of the finish is gone from the barrel, and there is some patina, and also a bit of light freckling on the hammer, however, overall condition of the pistol is still about 90%. The pistol has a crisp bore. This is a rare pistol for an Advanced Collection. We do not have any accessories for this gun. This is an antique firearm – if it is legal for you to own this firearm where you live, and with a copy of your Drivers License, establishing that you are over age 21, we can ship the gun direct to your home, an FFL License is not required.

title: For Sale:  FACTORY ENGRAVED COLT CLOVERLEAF  - IVORY GRIPS
postcontent: This pistol is excellent.  A high percentage of the original blue finish remains on the barrel and the cylinder. I don’t have the book, but you will find this pistol pictured on page 166 of R.L. Wilson’s book, COLT AN AMERICAN LEGEND. It is also pictured on page 166 of COLT HERITAGE. There is no question this is the pistol. The Cloverleaf House Pistol is a .41 caliber short. It is a rimfire cartridge. It has a four shot cylinder which is in a cloverleaf pattern. Hence the name “Cloverleaf”. The bore in the three-inch barrel is bright and shiny and rates at least a six, maybe better. It does have very strong lands and grooves. The numbers match. You will find the action to be tight and smooth. The lockup is tight as well. Only about 7500 of these were manufactured from 1871-1876. The ivory grips are in excellent condition. Pistols In this condition are hard to find. This one is better than most. No FFL required.

title: For Sale:  RARE COLT 1860 ARMY CARTOUCHE
postcontent: This Colt 1860 Army has been there. The numbers are mixed. You will find a cartouche on the left grip panel. They fit perfectly. The action and lock-up are tight. The bore has strong lands and grooves and will rate about a six on a 1-10 scale. The fit of the barrel to the frame is excellent. No number on the wedge. Barrel is 160177, frame 186877, trigger guard 35663, iron back strap 35663, arbor 6877, and cylinder 5442. Some of the barrel address remains. This is an interesting pistol. I do not guarantee this pistol to be 100% correct nor original.

This "BASIC" Windham Weaponry CF SRC .223 Rifle with a 16 inch Barrel and 30 round magazine has a Carbon Fiber Lower.  It is in the M4 Format - Black Matte finish - has a 6-Position Telescoping Buttstock - No Sights, (but I will get to that), has a 16" Chrome-Lined M4 Profile Barrel - is 32.375" Colapsed and 36.125 Extended - Weighs only 5.85 lbs - Shoots .223 - Holds 30 rounds +1 - Semi-Automatic - comes with 1 Magazine, (I will get to that too), - Carbon Fiber Flat Top Receiver - A2 Flash Suppressor, Optics Ready for Accessory Sights, (I will get to that too), - Rifleing is 1-9" RH Twist.

Basic Rifle $799.00.  Gun alone with no sights & no extra magazine and comes with case, 1 Magazine, sling, and a Dvidson's Lifetime Guarantee as described above is $799.00.

(Basic Rifle, $799.00)  Add an Extra Magpul Magazine is $812.75 two extra is $825.50, ($12.75 each), Add more?

(Basic Rifle, $799.00)  Add the Sightmark SM 13041 Red Dot Scope, Rifle now is $875.00 and you are still way under MSRP.

(Basic Rifle, $799.00)  Add a Sightmark Low Pro Green in Line Laser that mounts ahead of everythingm, (and it is Low Profile).  The Low Pro Green Laser is $95.00, and now your rifle is $894.00

I personally test a lot of firearms to see how they shoot.  I then do searches to see what others say about something and then form "MY" opinion.

Just for a little history here about Windham Weaponry.

A lot of people think that Windham Weaponry is a new company or they have never heard of them and it a new company as an entity goes, BUT.....the people that run Windham Weaponry are not new.  Several years ago, Bushmaster Firearms was bought out, and the previous owner of Bushmaster Firearms had to sign a not to compete agreement for five years. This meant that he couldn't make any AR-15 style rifles for five years.  I sold my Bushmaster Firearm because I didn't like the way it shot.  I had a hard time getting consistent and accurate groups with a lot of different types of ammo.

Enter back into the industry after being absent for five or so years, "Windham Weaponry". The new "Windham Weaponry" is is the old Bushmaster AR maker.  They are making the guns even better than they were originally made. These AR style rifles are even better than the old Bushmaster ARs were, "in my opinion".  A lot of the staff and people involved in the Windham Weaponry product are prior Bushmaster people including the owner, who used to own Bushmaster. Windham Weaponry are putting a lot of pride and detailed craftmanship in their new ARs. Their goal is to build the finest AR type rifle in the country and in my opinion they are getting close.  

Some ARs might cost an arm and a leg, but some are dirt cheap.  Paying an arm and a leg for an AR rifle doesn't always mean you are getting a lot more.  The Windham Weaponry AR I have, and the one I shoot is in my opinion one of the best built ARs out there for the consumer in what we refere to as the "New Modern Firearm".  My Windham Weaponry Firearm in the AR Platform is as close to the most accurate AR I've ever shot.  It is also the most consistently accurate AR I've shot with all types of ammo.

title: For Sale:  Kahr CM9 w/ MAGS PINKIES HOGUE GRIP! HOLSTER! LNIB! SHIPS TO YOUR FFL!
postcontent:
MUST SHIP TO FFL! (I live in the countryside and driving is a PITA lol)

Kahr

CM9 (like new condition)

9mm

$390 Shipped! (absolute lowest price anywhere for this many mags and near new CM9)

EXTRA MAGAZINES! PINKY EXTENSIONS! HOGUE GRIP! 3 Total Mags (1 it came with plus 2 more), 2 pinky extensions, Blackhawk Pocket Holster! Original box.

[url=http://s1276.photobucket.com/user/RealFitness86/media/box_zps9bd3b5cc.jpg.html][/url]
[url=http://s1276.photobucket.com/user/RealFitness86/media/holster_zps81b73a13.jpg.html][/url]

(ammo not included)

Will ship to your FFL via UPS or Fedex. I also have good reputation on calguns and you can check my history.

The Hogue Grip is AMAZING, you have to feel it to believe it. Feels more controllable then a fullsize standard grip because the Hogue is grippy and soft and has subtle swells in your hand plus the rubbery-ness absorbs recoil somewhat.

As others note, the trigger is also amazing, its long so its safe but its very smooth and medium-light pull weight. I had no problem hitting paper plates well past 50 yards from a rest.

I've carried both pocket and IWB and both work well. It REALLY feels like nothing IWB though (barely noticable), wheras pocket carry its like a wallet and more noticable.

Has original box, and has had roughly 40 rounds through it with no malfunctions (even though Kahr says there is a 200 round brake in period, still no problems even in the brake in period). For deep conceal CCW its unbeatable in my opinion, you get full power 9mm in a tiny package (I sometimes forgot I had it on me, no joke).

Its fired 115 grain Winchester white box and American Eagle 147 grain flat nose, both flawlessly. Recoil feels lighter with the 147 grain and noise seems less so 147's are my preferred load. 

I'm selling for financial issues, also I moved to an open-carry area so concealment isn't an issue anymore.

The retail for the Kahr ($420), extra mags ($70), grip ($9) and pinky extensions ($9) and fedex shipping (~$20) would come to $528 but I'm only asking $390 shipped. Discrete PP ok or let me know your payment preference.

Feel free to ask anything =)

*Final price reduction! $390/shipped is literally the best price on the web for this kind of package =)

title: For Sale:  RANGE BRASS ONCE FIRED WILL SHIP .223 38 Special .45 ACP .40 9MM 10MM
location: Byron Center/South GR, Michigan, United States
postcontent:
I have a variety of indoor range brass for sale.  They have been fired and still have the primers.  You will need to clean and deprime them yourself.  I try to pick out pieces that are Berdan primed or are bent to the point that they cannot be reloaded.  However, some of these may get into the bags.  I add an extra 10 pieces for every 500 to ensure you have quality pieces.  I hand count each bag and get rid of any aluminum or steel casings.  They are all brass or nickel coated brass! These are mixed headstamp and the .45s have not been sorted for primer size.  There are crimped, military rounds in .45s, 9mm and .223 mixed in.  These can be fixed with a cheap pocket reamer.   You will find a lot of Lake City and Remington in .223 as well as a 5.56 once in a while.  In the pistol cartridges, the majority are blazers, remingtons, winchesters, and federals.  There are also the military rounds, aguila, hornady, cor-bon, and speer to name a few.  

My current inventory is:
[9mm Luger] ***TEMPORARILY SOLD OUT*** bags @ 1k casings each ($40/bag) or ($75/2 bags)
[.40 S&W] 3 bags @ 1k casings each ($45/bag) or ($85/2 bags)
[.45 ACP] 6 bags @ 500 casings each ($45/bag) or ($85/2 bags)
[.223/.556] 5 bags @ 500 casings each ($60/bag) or ($110/2 bags)
[10MM] 2 bags @ 100 casings each ($20/bag) or ($35/2 bags)
[38 special] 1 bag @ 500 casings ($35)
[380 Auto] 1 bag @ 500 casings ($55)

You can meet me for the brass at M6 and 131 for Grand Rapids residents.  Or, I can ship the package nationally in flat rate boxes.  I will accept cash or paypal for all transactions.  I charge $7, $14, and $18 for 3 sizes of flat rate boxes.  A very small handling/paypal is included in those shipping prices to help cover my expenses or will be tacked on if meeting in person.  The $7 box can take very small packages while the $14 and $18 boxes will be more common for most orders.  

I will try to keep my inventory updated and add to it as I sort out new calibers.  I am trying to get my own small range brass business running and you can even come see me at the Grand Rapids gun show in January.  Email me to get a quote.  Let me know how many you want of the different calibers.  I will email my quote before sending an invoice for paypal.  Thanks for looking.

This is not live ammo.

title: For Sale:  12GA O/U Stoeger Double Defense Shotgun. (3" Mag/Rails/20" Barrels)
postcontent:
There's not a whole lot to say about this one. I bought it on impulse and loved it. Is it super practical? No. Can you use it for hunting? Hope your target is close. What it is, is super fun.

This is simply a black over under 12GA shotgun with two side rails, a top rail, jeweled block and a fiberoptic front post; It came like that to begin with. It's also pretty short with 20" barrels and seems shorter in person. Throw a light on it and use it for home defense, show your friends, mall ninja the piss out of it, whatever. It's a fun gun to shoot, throws flames for days and attracts attention at the range. Disassembles real easy and fits into a small bag. (I've taken it on trips for sketchy hotels)


Gun is 90% condition, has a couple tiny imperfections. Bores are like mirrors. Round count is at ~40 3" Magnum and ~25 2 3/4.


People sell these for $400-500 all day long, so I'm offering it for:
$350. Once again, NO TRADES.

title: For Sale/Trade:  PREBAN Olympic Arms AR-15 Excellent condition!!!  (pre ban with letter)
postcontent:
This is indeed a preban, and I have a letter from Olympic Arms confirming the serial number date range of production. See the photo which proves thus.

I would like to sell this within the state of Connecticut, as I do not want to see AR15s leaving the state...rather, I would like them to stay within the state lines, in the hands of peaceful, proud Patriots.

This rifle has the old-school "stop sign" SGW stamp, and the entire rifle is in excellent condition.  Estimate of number of rounds through it is less than 500.  Full 20 inch barrel.

Some Olympic Arms get knocked, and if a firearm has constant issues, it should be knocked.  This rifle has never given me any issues, and it has fired both .223 and 5.56NATO rounds with no issues whatsoever.   (Some people also knock 1911s, and others knock Glocks.  You have to see a firearm and research it to know the quality, really.)

If you are in the market for a preban, and especially if you do not want to get involved with the banned-by-name/not-named preban issue in the state of Connecticut, then this could be the rifle for you.

I am not looking to make money on this, I bought two prebans, and I decided I would rather sell this one and be able to buy another handgun.  I paid $2050 (after taxes and transfer fees.)  I would like to not sell this at a loss.  I am also open to the possibility for trading the preban for a handgun + cash.  I am in the market for a new or VERY lightly used 9mm semi-auto (Glock, Sig Sauer) and/or a nickel or chrome .38 special revolver.

All CT laws will be followed, forms, etc.

This rifle is in very good to excellent condition!  Hardly any wear or scrape marks, the finish is practically flawless, and it overall is quite nice.

This AR-15 will NOT have to be registered!  This is something to consider!

In Connecticut right now, if you want to buy an AR, you have two choices:
1. Not buy anything at all (or buy something illegally, and risk having ALL your firearms taken-  not advisable at all!!!)
2. Purchase an authenticated pre-ban A R  15 rifle and NOT have to register it with the state of CT.

All other AR15s, which are not prebans, must be registered as Assault Weapons with the State of Connecticut by January 1st, 2014.

Email me if you want to meet and inspect the rifle before purchase.  I also have more photos (only permitted to upload three images per listing.)

I am not taking a major loss on this, I probably should just sit on this and wait until after January 1st, and list it at $2400.  But, I am not looking to gouge, as MANY stores and individuals are right now across the state of CT.
Go take a look in some of the places such as 33King, BMG in Newington, and the horde of other places selling preban ARs in really beat up condition, with thousands of rounds through them, for hundreds more than this preban is listed as.

Thank you!

title: For Sale/Trade:  S&W M&P .38 SPL Victory Model
postcontent:
This is a S&W M&P "Victory Model" chambered in 38 Special. It is a pre model 10 revolver that, according to it's relatively low serial number (V69XX), was likely manufactured in May 1942 just a few weeks after the "V" prefix was added to the M&P serial numbers.

The gun is in very good condition. The bluing is 98% intact, the bore is shiny, the rifling is sharp, and the cylinder locks up nicely. The double-action trigger is very stiff and even in single action the trigger pull is fairly heavy. The gun does not seem to have been fired very much at all. The gun is in great shape as it is, and a simple at-home trigger job to alleviate the heavy trigger would turn this gun into a wonderful shooter.

The gun does not have the original wooden grips as they were replaced with ambidextrous ergonomic grips before I ever bought it.

title: For Sale/Trade:  SW K22 (pre-17)
postcontent:
For sale - Smith and Wesson Model K22, excellent condition.  6 inch barrel and blue finish (original).  The grips have been replaced with Pachmayrs.  

Serial Number is K 1327XX - the revolver is serial numbered on the frame, barrel and cylinder. I blurred the last two digits on the cylinder in the last pic.  

This is a five-screw SW K-frame.  

The revolver is in perfect mechanical condition and has extremely minor finish blemishes, most noticeable is a turn ring from firing approximately 250 rounds as well as faint wear at the muzzle from being placed in a soft case.  As you would expect, it is amazingly accurate and has impeccable timing.

This revolver is the predecessor of the Model 17 and is a remarkable example of how Smith and Wesson used to build revolvers.  I will be sad to see her go, but I am at a point where I no longer want to store the firearms I am not shooting.

When responding to this ad, please include your name and phone as well as your email.

I will transact FTF in Des Plaines IL or will ship the gun to your FFL for the actual cost of shipping.

Any FTF transaction will require 72hr wait time, FOID, bill of sale, per IL Law.

Thanks for looking!

postcontent: You are bidding on a Savage Model 11 "Lady Hunter" rifle chambered in 6.5 Creedmoor. This is the model with the wood stock with shortened length of pull and raised cheekpiece. This model is called the "Lady Hunter" but it is EXCELLENT for those of smaller stature and/or with high cheekbones. For more information, please see the manufacturer's website here: http://www.savagearms.com/firearms/finder/ Shipping is $30 for all firearms except 50bmg rifles which have a surcharge due to weight and $15 for components within the continental United States. Hawaii, Alaska, Guam, and Puerto Rico please contact us for shipping quotes. We will still ship to California. Please check your state laws and regulations to determine if this gun is legal in your state BEFORE YOU BID. We will combine shipping on multiple purchases. Shipping charges include full insurance for safe delivery. Trades considered, send email with detailed photos. 45 day layaway available with 30% deposit on purchases over $500.00. We reserve the right to end any auction not bid upon without warning. All listed items are available for viewing, sale, and pick up at our retail facility in Moses Lake, WA. We accept most payments except for PAYPAL and AMERICAN EXPRESS. A 3% credit card processing fee will be added to total payment if you choose to pay via credit card, unless done in Face to Face transactions. Washington residents are required to pay SALES TAX. All firearms come with a 3 day inspection period which starts when the firearm reaches your dealer. You may return the firearm during that period for a refund minus shipping and 3% credit card fee provided it is unfired and unmodified. The inspection period ends if the buyer chooses to take the firearm from the dealer. If firearm (i.e. antique firearms, black powder), or components are shipped directly to you, there are no inspection periods or returns accepted. We apologize for this inconvenience, however, once the firearm leaves the transfer dealer we cannot verify if the firearm or components has been fired or tampered with. We strive for customer satisfaction but reserve the right to approve and deny returns. There is a 20% restocking fee for items returned without approval. If you have a question about the firearm ASK BEFORE YOU BID. Information requested after the sale of the firearm does not excuse your obligation to purchase. Pre-owned firearms are visually inspected for listing purposes only, and it is the responsibility of the buyer to ensure they are safe to shoot prior to use. Any warranty repair on new or warranted items must be conducted through the manufacturer. Pre-owned firearms are sold AS IS and are believed to be functional, however they are not test fired or reviewed by a gunsmith. We use actual pictures of the items for sale when available and try to capture as accurate images as possible. However due to variations in coloring and contrast on computer screens, colors/imperfections may not be easy to see in photos. It is the sole responsibility of the buyer to provide us with FFL information. We accept no responsibility for delays in shipping if an FFL is not received in a timely manner and appropriately marked. Due to the high number of FFL's we receive on a daily basis, please make sure you reference your name and purchase on the FFL. Failure to do so can lead to delays in shipping.
